blog.name: vikingeggs
blog.title: tired gay and shook
blog.description: my name is egg, welcome to queer art hell :) i'm edgy as fuck and do art sometimes. my pronouns are he/him they/them or fae/faer. i'm a trans feminine enby, abrosexual. i'm 18, and i'm a nightmare to be friends with. feminist as fuck, truscum/radfems don't interact. art tag is "egg does an art."! art requests: open for harry potter stuff!

summary:
survival is a talent by ShanaStoryteller

  

A large silvery peacock cocks his head to the side, so well formed that Draco can...
caption:
survival is a talent by ShanaStoryteller

A large silvery peacock cocks his head to the side, so well formed that Draco can see the different pattern of feathers on his chest, to say nothing of his tail feathers, which are even taller than Draco. Clearly he’s improved since third year.

I’ve been meaning to post this for a long while, and I totally forgot to when the fic was updated. Whoops! My bad! Anyways, this was a huge pain to draw at the time and i struggled a lot with it (i painted it on a massive canvas in sai2, which crashed multiple times)

I’ve always loved @shanastoryteller‘s fic and I just am so happy I can share my love for it in art form.

blog.name: tomparkerpetermanspiderholland
blog.title: I Was Just Trying To Be Like You
blog.description: We all love a soft boy (he/him)

body:
The thing is that J. K. Rowling hasn’t and wouldn’t say the same about any of her straight characters as she said about Dumbledore…

I mean Idk about you, but I did not need to hear about Dumbledore’s sex life

blog.name: owningmyoriginality
blog.title: Owning My Originality
blog.description: Hello. This is a blog about me and my life. I am a 25 year old woman from the UK. I have Autism, Anxiety and have recently beat Depression after living with it for over 12 years. My Special Interests/Obsessions are History and Comedy. I wanted to create this blog to share/express/interact with people who have gone through the same/similar experiences as me and who like/are obsessed with the same/similar things as me.

summary: The ones that love us never really leave us. You can always find them, in here.
text: The ones that love us never really leave us. You can always find them, in here.
source: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban.

Me, who’s dumb ass has lived...
body:

blog.name: accio-shitpost
blog.title: shitpost managed
blog.description:
FAQ

unforgivably cursing you with our existence since 1965

as seen in Bo Burnham's Eighth Grade, apparently

we have a Discord server! join here! (15+ only please)

we track the tag 'accioshitpost' (without a dash) so if you have art or a fic based on of one of our posts, pop it in there and we'll reblog it for you! we always appreciate your creativity!

you can find our amazon wishlists here and here - if you get us anything, we'll post a picture and a thank you note!!

if you want to follow our personal blogs, here's Roxie's, here's Persephone's, and here's Jamie's

nazis, terfs, pedos, and anybody happy to defend or stand by them can leave. we don't want you. avada kedavra, shithead.

now in blue raspberry flavours, hitting stores soon!

summary: one thing i find interesting about harry’s progression in the books is how practical he becomes like, i’m reminded of the...
body:
one thing i find interesting about harry’s progression in the books is how practical he becomes

like, i’m reminded of the defence against the dark arts lesson on ghosts vs inferi, where he says ghosts are transparent, and ron defends him with ‘well if you met one in a dark alley that’s the first thing you’d look for’

they’re thinking about combat first. idk, i find that kind of sad in a way

reblog.comment:
one thing i find interesting about harry’s progression in the books is how practical he becomes

like, i’m reminded of the defence against the dark arts lesson on ghosts vs inferi, where he says ghosts are transparent, and ron defends him with ‘well if you met one in a dark alley that’s the first thing you’d look for’

they’re thinking about combat first. idk, i find that kind of sad in a way

they’re thinking about combat first. idk, i find that kind of sad in a way

blog.name: ao3feed-tomarrymort
blog.title: Tomarrymort On AO3
blog.description: An automated feed for the Tom/Harry and Voldemort/Harry AO3 tags. Not a fic recs blog.

title: A golden cage
description:
by OnePastMidnight

During the summer holiday after his fifth year, Harry gets kidnapped by the man he’d declared his archenemy, but is everything as it seems?
Life’d never been boring for Harry, but it seems like the raven haired teen has another challenge coming up.

- or, that one fanfic where Voldemort decided that swaying Harry to his side would equal winning the war against both Dumbledore and the ministry.

Words: 1360, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Harry Potter - J. K. Rowling
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Harry Potter, Tom Riddle, Severus Snape, Hermione Granger, Voldemort, Lucius Malfoy, Narcissa Malfoy, Draco Malfoy, Ron Weasley, Luna Lovegood, Neville Longbottem, others - Character
  • Relationships: Harry Potter/Tom Riddle
  • Additional Tags: Good Dark Side, they have cookies, the light side doesn’t have cookies, Only lemon drops, Kinda Dark, I guess???, Fluff, Angst, No Beta

summary:
Draco: You bought the wrong biscuits
Harry: No, just because I bought the biscuits you don't like doesn't mean they're...
body:
Draco: You bought the wrong biscuits

Harry: No, just because I bought the biscuits you don’t like doesn’t mean they’re wrong

Draco: They don’t have chocolate in them, Harry! How’s that right?

reblog.comment:
Draco: You bought the wrong biscuits

Harry: No, just because I bought the biscuits you don’t like doesn’t mean they’re wrong

Draco: They don’t have chocolate in them, Harry! How’s that right?

trail.content_raw:
Draco: You bought the wrong biscuits

Harry: No, just because I bought the biscuits you don’t like doesn’t mean they’re wrong

Draco: They don’t have chocolate in them, Harry! How’s that right?
trail.content:
Draco: You bought the wrong biscuits

Harry: No, just because I bought the biscuits you don’t like doesn’t mean they’re wrong

Draco: They don’t have chocolate in them, Harry! How’s that right?
